Package org.example.lab.agh

Class Library

java.lang.Object
org.example.lab.agh.Library
public class Library extends Object
The Library class represents a shared resource where readers and writers interact. It manages access to the library for readers and writers using semaphores and synchronization mechanisms to ensure proper handling of concurrent access. Readers can access the library simultaneously, but writers require exclusive access. This class maintains lists to track the current state of readers and writers, including those waiting, active, and completed.

  • Constructor Details

    • Library

      public Library(int nReaders, int nWriters)
      Constructs a new Library instance with the specified number of readers and writers.
      Parameters:
      nReaders - the number of readers
      nWriters - the number of writers

  • Method Details

    • runApp

      public void runApp()
      Starts the application by creating and starting reader and writer threads. Initializes semaphores to manage synchronization between threads.

    • startReading

      public void startReading(Reader reader)
      Handles the entry of a reader into the library. Removes the reader from the waiting list and adds them to the active list.
      Parameters:
      reader - the Reader instance entering the library

    • stopReading

      public void stopReading(Reader reader)
      Handles the exit of a reader from the library. Removes the reader from the active list and prints the updated state.
      Parameters:
      reader - the Reader instance leaving the library

    • startWriting

      public void startWriting(Writer writer)
      Handles the entry of a writer into the library. Removes the writer from the waiting list and adds them to the active list.
      Parameters:
      writer - the Writer instance entering the library

    • stopWriting

      public void stopWriting(Writer writer)
      Handles the exit of a writer from the library. Removes the writer from the active list and prints the updated state.
      Parameters:
      writer - the Writer instance leaving the library

    • getReadcnt

      public int getReadcnt()
      Gets the current count of active readers in the library.
      Returns:
      the number of active readers

    • setReadcnt

      public void setReadcnt(int readcnt)
      Sets the current count of active readers in the library.
      Parameters:
      readcnt - the new count of active readers

    • getNumWriters

      public int getNumWriters()
      Gets the total number of writers configured for the library.
      Returns:
      the total number of writers
